column4: description
column5: defeatedDescription
column6: goal

column4: Apparently the little creature finds you endlessly amusing.
column5: A faint demonic laugh can still be heard even after the imp's death.

column4: The fire of madness in his eyes sears even more deeply than the hot irons which scorched his own flesh.
column5: Knowing he is nearly defeated, the zealot looks you in the eyes and smiles as he plunges his own dagger into his throat.

column4: The vicious she-devil slowly draws her rune-carved black sword and stares hungrily at your soul.
column5: The black sword clatters against rocks on the floor as the last light leaves the she-devil's eyes.

column4: This mage's incantations are lost among his mad laughter and the roar of hellfire.
column5: You disrupt the warlock's spell, causing him to mis-cast. He is turned to ash in a burst of his own hellfire.

column4: The armored fiend moves with practiced precision, a consummate warrior form the armies of Hell.
column5: The battle is fierce, but in the end the forces of hell are no match for your righteous prowess.

column4: Standing before you, sword and shield in hand, towers a front-line soldier in hell's army.
column5: You chip a piece of horn from the fallen devil, a trophy from a worthy opponent.

column4: The demonic child of a succubus grins as hellfire gathers in his hand.
column5: "Today is not my day to die," whispers the wounded magus as he vanishes in a cloud of fire and ash.

column4: Taking his place in the circle, the summoner prepares to unleash hell itself.
column5: As the summoner struggles to speak the final incantation, you are able to land a final, mortal blow.

column4: You know there are more embarrassing ways to die, but none come to mind...
column5: Wave after wave of demonic fodder falls to your attack. When the frenzy is over, you don't see a single body in the room. Was it all a dream?

column4: Summoners in place, the cult of Asmodeus worshipers prepares for rise of their god.
column5: You are able to defeat the summoners before they can complete their ritual. The gates of hell will stay closed for now.

column4: Poison-tipped darts impact the wall nearby as the lizardfolk warrior lunges at you.
column5: The scales make for effective natural armor, but it's not enough to stop you from defeating the darter.

column4: Colors shift across this Lizardfolk warrior's scales as he appears as if from nowhere to strike with his spear.
column5: Knowing he is nearly defeated, the hunter hides behind cover. You wait for him to reemerge, but he seems to vanish as mysterious as he appeared.

column4: One more step and you would have been caught in the lizardfolk's trap, but you're able to defend yourself as he rushes in to finish the job.
column5: You knock the lizardfolk off balance, causing him to fall into his own trap. He struggles for a moment and then lies completely still.

column4: The swamp gathers around your feet, as though being manipulated by an unseen force.
column5: The swamp returns to normal as soon as the marsh mystic falls.

column4: A powerful tail swings to knock you off balance, an easy target for the brutal greatclub.
column5: The bruiser relentlessly lands blow after punishing blow. Even after the battle is over, you wait for a minute to see if he'll rise up and attack again.

column4: Swimming through the waters, the scouts nearly slip by unnoticed.
column5: You are able to avoid the scouts' detection. The element of surprise proves to be the key to winning the battle.

column4: A group of hunters secure the area while the trappers prepare to capture tonight's feast.
column5: Watching the lizardfolk's preparation and seeing their overwhelming numbers, you decide to avoid the battle altogether

column4: A greenscale hunter sits on the ground, seemingly all alone...
column5: Seeing the lizardfolk's trap for what it is, you find and take out the hidden hunting party before easily defeating the bait.

column4: It almost looks like that marsh mystic is having a conversation with a pair of crocodiles...
column5: You interrupt the druid mid-conversation. He regards you for a minute before turning back to the crocodiles and picking up where he left off.

column4: Wild even for a blackscale, the massive lizardfolk sends its greatclub crashing down inches from where you stand.
column5: You're not sure how you survived the battle, and hope to never deal with a lizardfolk like that again.

column4: The gluttonous creature lifts its ruddy maw from the ruined carcass it had been feasting on, looking for a new meal.
column5: You slice open the troll's belly, ejecting its last few meals. The troll tries desperately to reclaim its prizes as you hit it with a final fiery attack.

column4: Though a runt among his own kind, this vicious troll is easily the size of a man, and far stronger.
column5: If that was a runt, you are not looking forward to facing a full-size troll.

column4: The thought that someone has been training trolls in the art of war and arming them is almost more frightening than the creature itself.
column5: Easily the toughest troll you've ever fought, you take some time after the battle to gather yourself and marvel at your victory.

column4: Somehow more frightening than other varieties, the fell troll licks its lips before roaring towards your fresh meat.
column5: Using both fire and acid to defeat the monstrosity, you don't leave the carcass until it has been completely reduced to ash.

column4: You've heard tales of hollow-eyed emaciated trolls like this, but you never thought you'd have to fight one.
column5: The ancient troll does its best to avoid your fiery attacks, but is unable to dodge them forever. You leave the corpse still burning on the ground.

column4: As a pack, these troll runts more than make up for their relatively smaller size.
column5: Victorious, you feel as though you single-handedly defeated a small army.

column4: Smarter than your average troll, this one almost seems to be assessing the situation instead of simply charging into battle.
column5: Both parties nearly defeated, the troll suggests you go your separate ways; it wants to live another day, and so do you.

column4: This troll seems willing to play some kind of game before it feasts on your bones.
column5: The troll frowns as you answer its last riddle correctly. It steps aside and lets you pass.

column4: Looking at you with desperate eyes, the troll drools out the words, "More... meat..."
column5: "More... meat..." mutters the troll as it dies ablaze at your feet.

column4: It can be difficult to tell a normal troll from an angry troll...
column5: You look around the nearly obliterated room and wonder how it's still standing after absorbing so many wild troll attacks.

column4: The werewolf howls before lunging at you!
column5: Your silvered blade plunges into the werewolf, freeing it forever from its curse.

column4: As if claws and fangs weren't enough, this werewolf has grabbed a sword as well.
column5: You battle back against the werewolf, proving to be too much even for this skilled creature. It howls as it slinks off into shadow.

column4: Shifting between forms, the deadly beast snarls, revealing rows of jagged teeth built to terrify as well as rend.
column5: As it slumps to the ground, the werewolf shifts back into human form, revealing the frail, tormented soul now freed.

column4: Lightning crackles around the beast, dancing from claw to claw.
column5: The stormcaller is defeated. Looking around, you see the scorched earth left behind.

column4: At first you only see one or two, but soon you realize the rest of the pack is surrounding you.
column5: You fight off as many as you can. Just as all hope seems lost, a howl echoes from the distance and the werewolves scatter. Whatever is coming closer must be terrifying...

column4: Shunned by others of its kind, this bloodthirsty beast looks to take its pain and suffering out on you.
column5: You defeat the cursed creature, ending its pain once and for all.

column4: Keeping low to the ground, the creature skulks through the area, seeking prey for the rest of the pack.
column5: Having caught your scent, the werewolf had hoped to alert the rest of his pack before it was too late. Fortunately, you did not let that happen.

column4: The mighty barbarian before you howls like a wild beast, and in moments, transforms into one!
column5: Defeated, the werewolf transforms back into human form, nearly as large and frightening as its bestial counterpart.

column4: Scars from previous victories act as highlights for the weathered, gray face.
column5: The aged creature licks blood from its cut hand and snarls at you before running into the darkness.

column4: The transformation is happening quickly. Now is the time to strike!
column5: You are able to catch the creature mid-transformation, making the battle much easier than it might have been.

column4: This long-dead soldier still has some fight in it.
column5: You send the soldier back to its grave, hoping it will rest easy this time around.

column4: The rotting gelatinous bulk of this undead horror shambles toward you, ignoring blow after blow.
column5: It takes several good tugs before you're able to pull your blade from the gelatinous carcass.

column4: This bag of bones can barely stand with all of its martial implements.
column5: The weight of the monster's gear proved to be more of a liability than a benefit.

column4: Though the years have not been kind to the man, the soldier within still stands strong.
column5: The skeleton put up a good fight, but in the end, the dead will stay dead.

column4: Blade in hand, the former soldier stands prepared for any attack.
column5: Never tiring, each of the soldier's subsequent strikes are just as deadly as the first. You, on the other hand, are exhausted at the end of the battle.

column4: Ranks of skeletons form around you, ready for war.
column5: You wade through a tide of bone and metal, dropping skeleton after skeleton.

column4: A massive hand juts through the ground and grabs your leg!
column5: You are able to defeat the zombie before it's fully out of the ground, saving you the trouble of having to bury it.

column4: Its own muscles tearing from bone, the undead monster lunges out at anything it can grab.
column5: The battle is a blur. In the end, the zombie is in pieces and you're not entirely sure what just happened.

column4: Diseased chunks of flesh fall from the rotten creature as it drags itself towards you.
column5: With no magical life force holding it together any more, rotten flesh falls from the corpse.

column4: Pestilence and rot seem to infect everything the monster touches.
column5: You do your best to avoid touching the creature's carcass, afraid of the pox it might carry.

column4: A small bit of blood provides a hint as to the trap's location.
column5: Knowing its location makes the spike trap easy to avoid.

column4: You see a deep set of marks on the wall.
column5: Searching the area, you find and disable the arrow bank's pressure plate.

column4: A series of gears click as you step on the pressure plate.
column5: You swing your body deftly to the side, avoiding the onslaught of darts.

column4: A sickly-sweet scent is coming from the floor.
column5: Knowing the poison vent trap has already been triggered, you hastily escape the room before the toxins fill your lungs.

column4: You can just hear otherworldly voices faintly chanting as you see strange runes glowing on the floor.
column5: You are able to disable the mechanism before the summoning trap can complete its ritual.

column4: You hear a click and then... nothing. Was that it? Are you in the clear?
column5: You look around, waiting for the other shoe to drop. Nothing. You will want to keep your eyes open as you continue on your adventure...

column4: The trap hasn't fully reset yet and before it closes all the way you hear the faint whimper of a less-skilled adventurer.
column5: As soon as the trap resets, you pry it open to see if the adventurer can be saved. Sadly, he cannot.

column4: Days were spent constructing a trap that will only have seconds worth of show time.
column5: Having successfully disabled the trap, you marvel at its construction and wonder if, perhaps, simpler would have been better...

column4: Any trap maker would be proud to build such a solid and reliable device.
column5: Once disabled, you take some of the finely crafted components for use in a later device of your own.

column4: One wrong step, one wrong word and there won't be anyone left standing.
column5: Hands still shaking, you're able to disarm the trap without incident.

column4: The heavy stone of this box is engraved with ancient dwarven runes.
column5: You slide the weighty lid to the side and smile at the treasure within.

column4: Faded but ornate designs decorate this chest, showing it perhaps contains items of some worth.
column5: You admire the craftsmanship of the chest for a while before opening the lid to examine the contents.

column4: And to think you never would have found this well-hidden trove if you hadn't tripped on that rock.
column5: Taking what you can carry, you re-hide the cache and mark your map for future visits.

column4: A shining tumble of nearly-glowing gemstones are piled higher than your dreams of avarice.
column5: The most precious gems gathered, you do your best to hide the rest for your next visit.

column4: The lustrous shine of this pile of wealth is finally enough to overcome your caution.
column5: Quickly, you gather what you can and move along before the treasure's owner returns.

column4: You find a large leather case with the initials "GDY" engraved and lined with silver.
column5: Unable to open the case without damaging it, you stash it to be investigated when you have the time to do it right.

column4: You can feel the magic enchantments protecting this chest, but with time anything can be opened.
column5: Finishing your final incantations, you open the chest, revealing the precious loot within.

column4: Through the glass you can see the finger bone of some long-dead saint.
column5: You decide for now to leave the bone where it is, knowing someone will pay a pretty penny for this discovery.

column4: It's hard to say exactly how long this treasure has been hidden away, but it's clearly been many, many years.
column5: You scrape away years of dust and dirt to discover an impressive array of riches.

column4: Someone had hidden this away years ago and never came back to claim it.
column5: You find a small coin, stamped with a family crest. At least now you can guess the family that lost these riches so many years ago.

column4: A misty image of a place you've never seen hovers over this crystal.
column5: When your vision clears, you find yourself in the place you'd seen in the crystal.

column4: This intricate stone mechanism is clearly a puzzle meant to hide the way beyond.
column5: As soon as the puzzle is solved, it melts into the stone wall, revealing a hidden passage.

column4: Depending on the angle held, this mirror can show the reflections of distant places.
column5: With the mirror tilted towards the desired location, you touch a gem on the handle and find yourself whisked away to the remote destination.

column4: Touching the painting, you realize this is a gateway, not art.
column5: You step through the painting and find yourself magically transported to a new place.

column4: You aren't sure anything corporeal can use this bridge, but there's only one way to find out...
column5: Stepping onto the bridge, you look back to see your starting location vanish into darkness. With no choice but to move forward, you cross to the other side, magically transported to a brand new place.

column4: A heavy iron gate slams down before you, blocking your path.
column5: It takes all of your strength, but eventually you are able to lift the iron bars.

column4: You leap back from the archway as one of the stone figures strikes at you before returning to her tranquil pose.
column5: The guardian refuses to let you pass, forcing you to destroy the magical construction.

column4: A golden gate blocks your path. While not overly sturdy, it's incredibly heavy.
column5: Too heavy to lift, you eventually discover the mechanism that will release the gate.

column4: The scuff marks on the ground tell you these stones can move, but it's not immediately apparent how the contraption works.
column5: After studying the mechanism, you find the trigger: a simple stone gargoyle that, when turned, reveals a hidden entrance.

column4: Bars of bone have been put in place to both frighten and keep out unwanted visitors.
column5: Though frightening, the gate proves no real challenge for those brave enough to approach.

column4: By the side of a tranquil pool lays an old fishing pole and a pair of moldering boots.
column5: Convinced the area is secure, you relax and take a much needed break at the edge of the pond.

column4: The walls are freshly daubed with crude markings in the argot of trolls, describing your party as new prey.
column5: You wipe off the markings, hoping the trolls' collective memory is as weak as you suspect.

column4: You cannot say whether this tarnished idol depicts a lost god or an unknown monster.
column5: Regardless of what this idol represents, you pocket it hoping someone will be willing to buy it from you.

column4: This altar has been desecrated by the followers of dark gods.
column5: You perform a cleansing ritual, but it does not seem like anything can completely remove the evil that corrupts this place.

column4: The clear water of this fountain seems unnaturally inviting and refreshing.
column5: You take a sip from the fountain and feel completely refreshed and rejuvenated.

column4: Smoke swiftly fills the room, followed by an advancing tide of fire.
column5: You run away as fast as you can, the fire licking at your heels.

column4: Tattered robes and burned bones litter the floor around a broken summoning circle.
column5: Studying the markings, you believe a devil was summoned here and then released. It may still be nearby...

column4: This well-tended camp besides a warm fire would be a serene scene if only the camp's owners weren't missing.
column5: Warming yourself by the fire, you wait for the owners to return. Hours pass before you give up and continue on your adventure.

column4: Charts and maps of impossible places line the walls of this room.
column5: You study the maps for a while before determining they must have been sketched by a madman.

column4: This stash of weaponry was partially looted, but may still hold something of value.
column5: Looking closer at the remaining items, you see tiny explosive runes on each piece of gear and dried blood on the walls.

column4: As your lights gutter and die, an inhuman voice hidden in the shadows whispers, "You'll never escape alive."
column5: You yell back into the darkness but there is no response, save the fading chuckle of something otherworldly.

column4: Splashes of color on the walls and floor, along with open jars of glowing liquid, show someone had applied this magical paint to an object that is now gone.
column5: Using a small amount of the liquid, you sketch out a crude figure that suddenly comes to life and runs into the darkness. You set down the paint and walk away quietly.

column4: The dirt floor of the rooms heaves as something moves beneath the ground.
column5: You bang on the ground and the movement stops. Whatever it was has dug deeper or simply moved on.

column4: The tangle of plants here have overgrown everything beneath a living mat of roots and vines.
column5: Hacking away at the vines, you carve a path through to the other side. Before you have left the area, the plants have already begun to grow back.

column4: The strange flowers of this garden have been well tended by an unseen hand.
column5: You lean in to smell a flower but the rest of the party stops you, pointing to a skeleton in a similar pose on the other side of the garden.

column4: A demonic horde picks at a pile of bodies, greedily tearing off pieces of meat.
column5: While they're distracted, you attack and defeat the horde, adding their corpses to the pile.

column4: Embers on the floor glow and spark with each demonic verse spoken by invisible creatures.
column5: It's hard to defeat what you can't see, but you are able to destroy the markings on the ground before the invisible demons can stop you.

column4: A machine built for war. This one has yet to see the battlefield.
column5: You sabotage the machine, assuming no good can come from its use.

column4: The construct rests on the table, waiting for the right incantations to bring it to life.
column5: You try a few spells before giving up and leaving the construct where it is.

column4: "A moment, good friend. Glad tidings we send. But if you can't feed us, then bad blood between us. And sadly this day your life's end."
column5: Amused by the bard's rhyme, you share some of your provisions. They spin a tale of your future glory, thank you, and continue on their journey.

column4: Nose buried in an ancient tome, the scholar fails to notice anyone is nearby before stumbling into the middle of your campsite.
column5: "Oh! Oh my! I'm so sorry! Here, let me put your mind at ease!" he mutters as he waves his hands, vanishing before you can stop him.

column4: You have the element of surprise! It seems as though the bandits were never expecting anyone to find them.
column5: One by one, you dispatch the bandits, preventing them from committing any future crimes.

column4: A slender man with a toothy grin stands in front of a magical doorway and asks, "What is it that you can keep after giving it to someone else?"
column5: "Your word!" you exclaim. The man bows and vanishes in a puff of violet smoke.

column4: You find a garden lined with intricately carved statues. Some are incredibly life-like.
column5: Tapping on a statue, you hear a faint cry from within the stone. You look for a way to release these people, but it is beyond your power.

column4: Two men stand face to face, each with steels drawn. From the corner of his eye, one looks at you and whispers, "Do not interfere..."
column5: Keeping your distance you watch as the two men battle for honor. The winner thanks you for not interfering and hands you a small bag of coins.

column4: A simple sign hangs on the entryway, "Whatever they offer you, don't feed the plants."
column5: "Feed me..." groans the plant. "I'll make it worth your while..." You decide instead to do a little gardening...

column4: You find a series of messages that were carved into the stone many lifetimes ago.
column5: Unsure how to translate the text, you take a rubbing of the markings for others to examine.

column4: "Please, stay and chat awhile. I get so lonely. So lonely..."
column5: You finish your chat with the statue. Before you leave, it whispers, "For your kindness, you shall be blessed."

column4: Try as you might, you're not really sure how to console a sad spirit.
column5: The ghost in inconsolable. You may never know what has it so depressed... beyond being dead, of course.

column4: On an old, blood-stained scroll you read, "To 'L', my love. Should this note reach you before I am home, know that I think of you always and we will not be apart for much longer."
column5: You keep the scroll, hoping some day to deliver it to its intended recipient.

column4: Treasure is piled out to the armored walls of this secure vault
column5: You cart away as much treasure as you can, marking its location on your map for future visits.
column6: You've heard rumors of a secret Treasure Vault...

column4: The treasures of this room have been carefully categorized, organized, and indexed by a collector.
column5: You find the collector's long-dead corpse on the floor in front of a fine trophy. It would be a shame for all his hard work to go unappreciated, so you take what you can and promise to return for the rest.
column6: Fight your way through to the Protected Gallery.

column4: Treasure is piled high behind the massive throne which dominates this room.
column5: Undead guards appear to defend the treasure, but they are quickly dispatched, leaving the vast treasure up for grabs.
column6: There are stories of a mad king who kept all of his treasures within the Throne Room itself.

column4: Swirls of ethereal energy guard the relics hidden here.
column5: You carefully navigate the magical mists, speaking the correct words and making the proper gestures. The static in the air subsides, leaving many magical treasures unguarded.
column6: Do you dare unlock arcane secrets hidden inside the Chamber of Magic?

column4: One creature stands out from the pack, shouting that you've come for the wrong treasure.
column5: You stand victorious over the defeated guards. Now it's time to look through the treasure and see what needed so much protection...
column6: Do you have what it takes to gain access to the Guarded Treasury?

column4: A slow grind followed by an unearthly shriek is all you can hear. Surely there is a sizable reward for shutting down this hellish device.
column5: Demonic screams pierce your soul as the device falls to pieces. You gather a small section of the unholy thing, hoping to prove your good deed.
column6: You cannot allow evil to continue seeping from the Infernal Device.

column4: Is it art? A calendar? A shrine to long-dead gods? Whatever it is, it's surrounded by hooded priests brandishing blades and whispering an otherworldly chant.
column5: The priests defeated, an otherworldly face appears briefly before vanishing into darkness. Looks like this is a gateway to another plane. You are certain someone out there will pay handsomely to learn more about this.
column6: Will you be the first to solve the mystery of the Standing Stone Circle?

column4: This is it! The mother-lode! Although perhaps not quite as abandoned as first believed...
column5: You defeat the throngs of undead still haunting the mine. Now secured, you begin mapping out the best veins for mining.
column6: Many search for the Abandoned Gold Mine, but none return to tell the tale.

column4: "Welcome, travelers. I have many treasures to bestow, should you prove worthy of my gifts."
column5: The wizard smiles, "I haven't been this entertained in ages! I have so much to give you!"
column6: Though kind to those he deems worthy, few seek out the Wizard's Library.

column4: Dark, demonic creatures slowly surround the tomb, turning the sanctified grounds into blackened corruption.
column5: You drive back the black spirits, purifying the priest's tomb. Almost instantly you feel a warmth fill your soul and hear a voice say, "You shall be blessed."
column6: It has been far too long since anyone visited the High Priest's Tomb.

column4: You catch Mizreal in the middle of some dark summoning ritual. You need to act quickly!
column5: "So... Close..." Mizreal says as the last drops of life drip from her wounds.
column6: End the unholy rituals of Mizreal Everdark.

column4: Surrounded by a legion of loyal followers, it will be difficult to reach Rohini.
column5: The followers defeated, Rohini tries to make a deal for her life. Unfortunately for her, you are not in a dealing mood.
column6: Stop the ashmadai leader Rohini the Prophet.

column4: Bathed in hellfire, this monstrous creature will be difficult to defeat.
column5: "No...!" screams the devil as it vanishes in a burst of smoke and hellfire.
column6: Defeat the Pit Fiend and end its reign of terror.

column4: So named for his slick black scales, this massive brute has become the leader to a tribe of lizardfolk.
column5: The enormous blackscale crashes to the ground with a THUD that ripples through the entire swamp.
column6: Remove Slickskin from his swamp.

column4: Swirling the swamp water with a massive spear, The Scalefather seems to be preparing a spell.
column5: Defeated, the lizardfolk sinks into the swamp, never to be seen again...
column6: Find and defeat the lizardfolk leader known as The Scalefather.

column4: Known for eating boulders when desperate, Hurlan is always looking for his next meal.
column5: Hurlan goes up in a burst of fire, guaranteeing no chance of regeneration.
column6: Defeat the exceptionally stupid, Hurlan Rockbiter.

column4: One of the largest and most feared of all the fell trolls, Marpog has been known to lumber from town to town, devouring entire populations.
column5: You pour an extra pot of acid over Marpog. And another. And one more for good measure.
column6: Stop Marpog Grumblegut from devouring any further villagers.

column4: You catch a glimpse of Thunderhowl in his human form. He remains every bit as intimidating.
column5: A large, naked human lies at your feet, no longer the menacing werewolf you were forced to kill.
column6: Bring down the werewolf known as Thunderhowl.

column4: You find the packmaster barking orders to a throng of wolfen followers.
column5: The other werewolves howl in misery at the death of their fallen leader.
column6: Defeat Packmaster Zayev and his followers will scatter.

column4: The wolfen terror of the Sword Coast, Runs-Red-Howling has made his home here, safe from most adventurers.
column5: The death of Runs-Red-Howling signals a giant leap towards security along the Sword Coast.
column6: Prevent Runs-Red-Howling from terrorizing another town.

column4: The massive creature known only as The Feared stands before you, its massive size shaking you to your core.
column5: The Feared collapses, now nothing more than a giant pile of rotting flesh.
column6: Summon your courage and destroy The Feared.

column4: Once a proud soldier, all that remains is a bit of torn clothing draped over a frame of rotting bone.
column5: Metal and bone crash down to the ground, shattering any parts of the creature that you hadn't already destroyed.
column6: Defeat the risen soldier and undead leader Ironbones.
